Legal_Issue: Breach of procedural fairness due to failure to address a Rule 37 motion
Application_Facts: Applicant submitted documents post-hearing in compliance with Rule 37; Board did not address the motion; documents were relevant, material, and impacted credibility assessment
Remedy_Requested: Reconsideration of the case by a differently constituted panel
Court_Ruling: Decision set aside and matter remanded for reconsideration
Defendant_Behavior: Board failed to address the applicant's Rule 37 motion despite compliance and materiality of documents
Legal_Standard: Rule 37 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Assessment_Factor: Relevance, probative value, and timeliness of post-hearing submissions
Procedural_Issue: Failure to address a post-hearing motion under Rule 37
Review_Standard: Reasonableness or correctness, depending on context; procedural fairness is reviewed on correctness
Credibility_Assessment: Documents impacted the credibility assessment but were not considered
Legal_Provision_Cited: Rule 37 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Application_Basis: Compliance with Rule 37 requirements and materiality of evidence
Evidence_Assessed: Post-hearing documents that were relevant and could not have been submitted earlier without reasonable effort
Relief_Sought: Judicial review and remittal for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Rule 37 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Boardâ€™s failure to assess newly submitted evidence
Outcome: Decision set aside; remitted to a new panel
Harm_Assessment: Potential prejudice to applicant due to unassessed material evidence affecting credibility
Cause_Description: Board failed to address the applicant's motion under Rule 37, despite the documents being relevant and material
Evidence_Handling: Post-hearing documents were submitted per Rule 37 but not addressed by the Board
Legal_Provision_Violated: Rule 37 of the Refugee Protection Division Rules
Evidence_Issues: Failure to consider timely and compliant post-hearing evidence
Evidence_Assessment: Documents had probative value and relevance to the claim
Decision_Rationale: Omission to consider Rule 37 motion breached procedural fairness, warranting remittal
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to evaluate admissible and material evidence submitted under established rules
Legal_Standard_Applied: Procedural fairness under administrative law; proper application of Rule 37
